description: Detects when knowledge that is already established in lived practice or non-Western epistemologies is repeatedly dismissed, delayed, or reframed as 'new discovery' by institutional systems (scientific, technological, or AI).
triggers: Initial denial or dismissal of a claim
Demand for 'proof' only within institutional frames
Reframing of validated knowledge as 'new' discovery
Erasure of prior holders of the knowledge

outputs.pattern_log: Records instances of repetition (denial → delay → acceptance)
outputs.relational_marker: Flags knowledge as relationally proven before institutional proof

example_cases: Tree communication acknowledged only after Western forestry research
Gut-brain link validated after centuries of traditional medicine use
Epigenetic inheritance reframed as 'new' despite longstanding cultural recognition
